*Cinnamon Candied Ginger Syrup:
Combine 1/4 lb. peeled ginger root (sliced 1/8" on a 45-degree bias using a mandolin), 2 cups of water, and 4 cinnamon sticks in a pot (or pan) and bring to cusp of a light simmer. Continue to barely simmer for 30 minutes. Add 1 cup of demerara sugar and stir until fully dissolved. Lower heat and keep just below simmering. Continue to heat until almost all liquid is reduced and remaining sugar is just beginning to caramelize (2-3 hours). Remove from heat and spoon slivers of ginger (along with a generous dollop of now thick syrup) onto a sheet of parchment or wax paper. Let cool for at least 2 hours then store layered on the paper sealed in a ziplock bag. Remove cinnamon sticks and reserve syrup.

*Strawberry & Black Pepper Shrub:
-- 1 cup Sliced Strawberries
-- 1 cup Granulated Sugar
-- 1 cup Champagne Vinegar
-- 1 handful of Black Balinese Peppers

Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl. Using a potato masher or a wooden spoon, mash the berries so they release their juices. Stir until the sugar has mostly dissolved and refrigerate overnight.
The next day, remove the mixture to a saucepan and heat gently over medium-low heat. Do not bring to a simmer--you simply want to heat the mixture to coax the sugar to dissolve.
Strain the shrub through a fine mesh strainer. If desired, strain again through a coffee filter. Refrigerate.

*Jasmine Tea/Rice-Infused Junipero Gin:
-- 1 bottle (750ml) Junípero gin
-- .5 cup Jasmine Tea
-- .5 cup Jasmine Rice (wash rice to eliminate starch)

Infusion Version: Wash the jasmine rice to clean out the starch. In a cambro/mason jar, add Junípero gin and jasmine tea and rice. Let infuse for 24 hours. Fine strain into bottle.

Ingredients: 1.25 oz Lillet Rose, .75 oz BarSol Primero Quebranta Pisco, .75 oz Prata Cachaca, .25 oz Velvet Falernum
Preparation: Stir with ice and strain into a Nick & Nora glass. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.

Ingredients: 2 oz H by HINE, .5 oz Tempus Fugit Creme de Noyaux, .5 oz Orgeat, .375 oz Lemon, .375 oz Lime, 1 oz Heavy Whipping Cream, 1  Egg White
Preparation: Combine all ingredients and shake thoroughly without ice for several minutes. Add ice, shake, and strain into a tall collins glass. Top with soda and garnish with an orange wheel.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, 1 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 oz Orange juice, 1 dash Simple syrup, 2  Cucumber slices, muddled, 2  Raspberries, muddled
Preparation: Muddle two cucumber slices, two raspberries and simple syrup in a highball, add ice. Shake gin, ginger liqueur and orange juice with ice. Strain into highball glass.  Garnish with a candied ginger stick.

Ingredients: 1 oz Broker's Gin, 1 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, 2 oz Celery Root Puree, .5 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, .75 oz Simple Syrup, 3 dash Apple Bitters, 1 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation: Add all ingredients to a shaker and shake with ice, then double strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a celery leaf.

Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz Lemorton Pommeau de Normandie, .75 oz House-made Green Apple Purée*, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .5 oz Honey Syrup
Preparation:
Shake all ingredients. Serve over crushed ice in a collins glass. Garnish with a sage leaf.

*Substitute with Perfect Puree Green Apple flavor
Notes: Junipero Gin 20th Anniversary Signature Cocktail

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz Beet Thyme Reduction*, .5 oz Licor 43, .5 oz Lemon Juice, .5  Egg White
Preparation:
Shaken without ice, then with ice and strained into a large coupe. Garnished with candied thyme.

*Beet Thyme Reduction
-- 520 grams raw beets 
-- 344 grams honey
-- 2 oranges peeled (just the peels)
-- 2 sprigs of thyme
-- pinch of salt

Juice beets, add honey and let dissolve and cook for 15 mins. 
Add thyme and simmer for 5 more mins. 
Strain through a chinois into a container and then place in the fridge.
This makes 1 quart, so multiply as needed.
Use within 1 week.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz H by HINE, .75 oz Wild Turkey 101 Rye, .5 oz Bin 27 Port, .25 oz Yellow Chartreuse, 2 dash Mole Bitters
Preparation: Stir ingredients with ice and strain into Canadian Glencairn glass.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Absolut Vodka, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 oz Fresh Lemon Juice , 1 oz Ginger-Cinnamon Syrup*, 2 dash Bar Keep Lavender Spice Bitters,  top Club Soda
Preparation:
Combine vodka, ginger liqueur, lemon juice, ginger-cinnamon syrup and bitters in tins with ice and shake. Double strain into collins glass over fresh ice and top with club soda.

*Ginger-Cinnamon Syrup: 
Equal parts demerara sugar, clover honey, fresh ginger juice, water. Combine demerara sugar and clover honey and top with boiling water. Stir to dissolve. Once cooled add fresh ginger juice and stir to mix.

Ingredients: 2 oz Ypioca Brasilizar Cachaca Prata Reserva Especial, 1.5 oz Sweetened Condensed Milk, 1 oz Passion Fruit (fresh or puree), .5 oz Pilon Syrup*
Preparation:
Add all of the ingredients, except seeds, to a shaker with ice and shake well. Double strain onto fresh ice into a collins glass. Garnish with 1 spoon of passion fruit seeds.

*Pilon Syrup:
Homemade 50/50 simple syrup using Pilon Sugar made from Mexican Sugar Cane.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .5 oz Aperol, .5 oz Raspberry/white pepper syrup, .5 oz Fresh lemon juice, .5 oz Fresh cucumber juice, 4-5 pc Fresh mint, 2 dashes Celery bitters
Preparation: In a mixing glass muddle mint, add all other ingredients and ice, shake, fine strain into a double old fashioned glass over fresh cracked ice. Garnish with cucumber slices and raspberries.

Ingredients: 2 oz Ypioca Brasilizar Cachaca Prata Reserva Especial, 1.5 oz Fresh Passion Fruit, 1 oz Condense Milk, .25 oz Brown Sugar Syrup (2:1)
Preparation: Add all ingredients to blender and blend throughly. Double strain into a glass with cracked ice garnish with a mint sprig and fresh grated nutmeg.

Ingredients: 1 oz Vodka, 1 oz Gin, 1 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .5 oz Cointreau
Preparation: Shake. Serve up. Garnish with lime wheel.

Ingredients: 2 oz Nikka Whisky Taketsuru Pure Malt 12 YO, .25 oz Rich Cane Syrup, 2 dash Bittermens Xocolatl Mole Bitters, 2 dash Cinnamon Bitters
Preparation: Build in rocks glass. Use cylinder ice cube.

Ingredients: 2 oz H by HINE, .25 oz Small Hand Foods Pineapple Gum Syrup, 1 bsp Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, 2 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation: Build in an old fashioned glass over ice. Garnish with orange peel.
Notes: Featured on Speed Rack 2015 SF Speed City Takeover Baseball Card.

Ingredients: 1.25 oz Apricot-Infused H by HINE, 1 oz Napoleon Amontillado, .25 oz Mandarine Napoléon, .5 oz Lazzaroni Amaro
Preparation: Stir with Ice and strain into a small wine glass.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Tequila, 1 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .5 oz Aperol, .25 oz Lime Juice
Preparation: Shake. Serve up. Top with sparkling rose. Garnish with lime peel.

Ingredients: Glenrothes Vintage Reserve,   Coffee-Infused Lustau East India Solera,   Cinnamon Syrup,   Milk
1.5 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, 1 oz Luxardo Aperitivo, .75 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth di Torino Rosso, 1 dash Grapefruit Bitters, 1 pinch Kosher Salt
1.5 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, .5 oz Jummai Ginjo Sake, .25 oz Luxardo Limoncello, .25 oz Dill Cordial, .5 oz Meyer Lemon Juice, .25 oz Yuzu Juice, .5 oz Fresh egg White
Preparation: Dry Shake, add ice and shake for 10 seconds. Double strain into a Copita Glass. Garnish with Dill.

Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Aperitivo, .5 oz Lemon Juice, .5 oz Orange Juice, .5 oz Simple Syrup,  top Anchor California Lager
Preparation: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass. Add ice and integration shake. Pour over fresh ice into a highball and top with California Lager. Garnish with a half orange wheel.
Notes: First served at Tales of the Cocktail 2014 "Luxardo CAP Lunch"

Ingredients: 1.25 oz Luxardo Amaretto di Saschira, 1 oz Rye Whiskey, 1 oz Lemon Juice, .75 oz Angostura Bitters, 1  Egg White
Preparation: Dry shake all ingredients for 20-30 seconds. Then shake with ice. Double strain over fresh ice in an old fashioned glass. Garnish with wide lemon swath.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Mezcal, .5 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 1 oz Apple Cider Reduction, .5 oz Cinnamon-Chipotle Syrup*, 1 dash House-made Apple Pie Bitters**
Preparation:
In a mixing glass, add ice and shake with all of the ingredients. Strain over new ice (large sphere ice cube) and serve in old fashioned glass and grate fresh cinnamon over the ice.

*Apple Cider Reduction: Boil apple cider until it reduces in volume by half.

**Cinnamon-Chipotle Syrup: Bring 1 cup sugar, 1 cup water and 3 cinnamon sticks to boil, take off heat and let steep for 20mins, add chipotle powder and mix well.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz BarSol Primero Quebranta Pisco, 1 oz BarSol Perfecto Amor (Aperitif Wine), .25 oz Leopold Bros. Bitter, .25 oz Velvet Falernum,   Red Hawaiian Salt
Preparation:
Barrel aged in a used bourbon barrel that previously held a cocktail containing Hine Cognac and Luxardo Bitter.

Stir with ice and strain into a small coupe. Garnish with an orange twist.

Ingredients: 2 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .25 oz Serrano Pepper Syrup*, 1.5 oz Mango Juice, 2 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation:
Serve in a julep cup with crushed ice and basil garnish.

*Serrano Pepper Syrup:
Take 6 serrano peppers. Slice 4 in half, carefully de-vein and seed them (this will take some of the heat away, make absolutely sure to wash your hands after handling the peppers, avoid touching anything unless you've washed your hands), place a skillet on medium to high heat and roast the peppers until they are a little charred. Once charred place in a blender with about 2 cups of water and throw in the 2 remaining fresh serranos (seeds and all). Blend and strain out the solids. Add 1 cup of demarara sugar to the serrano pepper water and stir until it is dissolved.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz H by HINE, .5 oz Jamaican Rum, 1 tsp Cacao, 1 tsp Branca Menta, 1 tsp Demerara, 1 dash Mole
1.5 oz Chinaco Blanco Tequila, 1 oz Vermut Vermouth, .5 oz Giffard Banane du Brésil, 3 dash Bittercube Jamaican #2 Bitters
Preparation: Stir in a mixing glass to chill down and serve up in a coupe with a lemon zest garnish.
Notes: * Mixture is barrel aged for 5 months in a used Bourbon Barrel

Ingredients: .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Ancho Reyes Chile Liqueur, .5 oz Montelobos Mezcal, .5 oz Aviation Gin, .5 oz Grapefruit Juice, .5 oz Lime Juice, 2 dash Bittercube Bitters Jamaican #2, 2 oz Fever-Tree Ginger Beer
Preparation:
Shake all ingredients. Strain and top with ginger beer. Give it a quick stir. 

Tajin ground ginger and salt rim.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Christmas Spirit, 1 oz Oloroso Sherry, .25 oz Walnut Liqueur, 3 dash Regans' Orange Bitters, 3 dash Pear Bitters
Preparation: Mix ingredients together then pour over crushed ice into a Julep tin. Dust with salt, sugar, and cinnamon.

Ingredients: 1 oz Montelobos Mezcal, .67 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Fresh Lime Juice, 3 oz Apple Cider, .5 oz Monin French Raspberry Syrup
Garnish: Cinnamon Quill, Small Flowers, Lime Wheel
Preparation: Chill cup and place a napkin around it. In the base of the cup put everything except the cider and the raspberry syrup and give a brief stir. Add some crushed ice. Stir vigorously. Top with crushed ice. Add cider. Pour raspberry syrup on top. Garnish with cinnamon quill as a stirrer, some small flowers, and a lime wheel.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Chinaco Blanco Tequila, .5 oz Luxardo Apricot Liqueur, .75 oz Lime juice, 1 oz Fresh Pineapple juice, .5 oz Simple syrup, 1 oz Soda water
1.5 oz Blanc Vermouth, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .5 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz Giffard Pamplemousse, .5 oz House-made Yellow Shaw-treuse*, .5 oz Tonic, 2 dash Celery Bitters, 2 dash Coriander Tincture
Preparation:
Combine all ingredients except for tonic. Shake with ice. Strain into a chilled coupe. Top with the tonic and garnish with a fresh grapefruit peel. 

*Substitute with Yellow Chartreuse Liqueur
Notes: Junipero Gin 20th Anniversary Signature Cocktail

Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Amaro Abano, 1 oz Old Overholt Rye, .5 oz Demerara Simple Syrup (1:1), .5 oz Lemon Juice, .75 oz Fuji Apple Cider
Preparation: Shaker and strain into a rocks glass with fresh ice. Garnish with an Apple Fan.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz St. Germain, .25 oz Yellow Chartreuse, .75 oz Lemon Juice, 1  Strawberry
Preparation: In a shaker, gently muddle the strawberry. Add the remaining ingredients and shake with ice. Strain into a coupe. Garnish with strawberry.

Ingredients: 2  Kumquats, 2  Lychee, 2 oz Bulleit Rye, 1 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .75 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, .5 oz Simple Syrup, .5 oz Egg White, .5 oz Fever Tree Ginger Beer
Preparation: Muddle the kumquats and lychee in a cocktail shaker. Add the whiskey, King's Ginger, lemon juice, syrup and white egg, and shake very hard. Double strain into a highball glass filled with ice spheres.

Ingredients: 2 oz Ypioca Cachaca Prata*, 1 oz Passion fruit juice, 1 oz Condensed milk
Preparation: Shaken, poured over fresh ice in highball. Garnish with macadamia nut. Coconut shaved rim.
Notes: *Kiwi-infused Ypioca Cachaca Prata

Ingredients: .5 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz Luxardo Bitter, .5 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth Bianco, .5 oz Dry Vermouth, 1 scoop Orange Sorbet, 2 drops Bittermens Orange Cream Citrate
Preparation: Whisk ingredients in birdie (or tin). Pour into coupe glass and top with Prosecco (1 oz). Garnish with dehydrated orange wheel. Spray orange flower from atomizer.

Ingredients: 1 oz Miso washed White Rhum Agricole, 1 oz Cocchi Vermouth di Torino, .75 oz Falernum, .75 oz Coconut Cream, .25 oz Luxardo Amaretto di Saschira, .75 oz Lime, .5 oz Mandarin Orange
Preparation: Shake and strain into a tiki cat filled with crushed ice.

Ingredients: 2 oz Nikka Whisky Taketsuru Pure Malt 12 YO, .75 oz C. Drouin Pommeau de Normandie, .25 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, 4 dash Black Walnut Bitters
Preparation: Combine all ingredients into a mixing glass and add ice. Stir for about 10 seconds and then strain into a chilled cocktail coupe. Garnish with skewered apple spheres and be thankful you're having a cocktail, and not having an apple shot off your head.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz H by HINE, .5 oz Luxardo Amaro Abano, .75 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, .75 oz Strawberry Syrup*, .5 oz Egg White
Preparation:
Add cognac, amaro, lemon, strawberry syrup and fresh cracked egg white of a whole egg to tin. Dry shake without ice approx. 5 seconds to emulsify. Add ice and shake hard again approx. 10 seconds. Fine strain into coupe. Crack drag black pepper over surface. Serve and enjoy.

*Strawberry syrup- 1 cup fresh strawberries 1 cup water 1cup sugar. Blend in vitamix then heat on stove and stir until hot to bind sugars, don't boil. Bottle and refrigerate.

Ingredients: 2 oz Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky, .75 oz Maurin Quina, .75 oz Luxardo Amaro Abano
Preparation: Stir. Use large ice cube.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Woodford Reserve Double Oaked, .75 oz Luxardo Bitter, .75 oz Rothman & Winter Orchard Apricot Liqueur, .25 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur
1.5 oz Hangar 1 Vodka, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .75 oz Ginger Zest, .5 oz Fragoli Strawberry, .5 oz Luxardo Bitter
1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 1.5 oz Nori-Infused Sake*, 1 dash Celery Bitters, 3 dash Islay Scotch
Preparation:
Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass, stir, and strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass. Garnish with a picked cucumber ribbon.

*Nori-Infused Sake: 
-- Ginjo Sake
-- Nori Seaweed Sheet

Using an Oji Style Cold Brew Coffee Maker, drip Ginjo sake through a 0.5 gram of nori seaweed sheet that has been hand-shredded. It takes 3 hours to infuse a 750 ml bottle.
Notes: Junipero Gin 20th Anniversary Signature Cocktail

Ingredients: 1 oz High West Oat Whisky, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Peach Shrub, .75 oz Lime, 1 dash Angostura Bitters, 1 dash Grapefruit Bitters
Preparation: Add all ingredients together.
Notes: Featured on the Padrecito cocktail menu august (fall) 2015

Ingredients: 2 oz Mezcal, .5 oz Mandarine Napoleon, .5 oz Lime Juice, 1 oz Castelvetrano Olive Brine, 3 dash Fennel Bitters
Preparation: Shake all ingredients for 10-15 seconds (over shaking will over dilute) and fine strain into chilled coupe glass. Garnish with Xoconostle (sour prickly pear) and a stuffed Castelvetrano olive.

Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz House-made Simple Syrup*, 1 oz Manzanilla Sherry, .75 oz Lemon Juice, 2 dash Absinthe, 6-8  Sugar Snap Peas,  top Tonic
Preparation:
Add 6-8 sugar snap peas to cocktail shaker. Lightly muddle the peas. Add all other ingredients except for the tonic. Shake and double strain into a collins glass. Top with tonic. 

*House-made Simple Syrup: 
-- 1 cup Sugar
-- 1 cup Water

Add equal parts sugar and water into a small saucepan, bring to a boil; simmer until the sugar is dissolved, approximately 3 minutes. Remove from heat, let cool to room temperature and transfer to a clean glass jar. Cover and keep refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.
Notes: Junipero Gin 20th Anniversary Signature Cocktail

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz Chateau de Montifaud Pineau des Charentes Blanc, .75 oz Lemon Verbena Cordial*, .5 oz Lemon Juice,  top Mixwell Young Ginger Ale
Preparation:
Shake all ingredients and double strain over fresh ice. Garnish with lemon verbena leaf.

*Lemon Verbena Cordial:
-- Fresh Lemon Verbena 
-- Fresh Mint
-- Grapefruit Peel 
-- Lemon Peel
-- Pure Cane Sugar
-- Citric Acid

Make a fresh herb and citrus peel tea and add sugar and citric acid to taste. Let cool before using.
Notes: Junipero Gin 20th Anniversary Signature Cocktail

Ingredients: 1.5 oz H by HINE, .75 oz Rye Whiskey, .75 oz Green Chartreuse, 2 dash Lemon Bitters, 1 splash Fernet-Branca
Preparation: Add cognac, rye, Chartreuse and bitters to a mixing glass with ice, and stir until cold. Add splash of fernet to a rocks glass, roll the glass to coat the sides, and discard the excess. Add one large ice cube to the glass, strain the drink over the cube, and garnish with a mint sprig.
Notes: Photo credit: liquor.com

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, .5 oz Velvet Falernum, .5 oz Lime, .5 oz Passion Fruit Syrup, 2 oz Belstar Sparkling Rose
Preparation: Shake first 4 ingredients and strain into collins. Top with pebble ice. Top with the rose. Garnish with a basil and a lime flower for aromatics.

Ingredients: .75 oz BarSol Perfecto Amor (Aperitif Wine), .5 oz Lime Juice, 1 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz Grenadine, 1 dash Angostura Bitters, 1 drop Bittermens Burlesque Bitters
Preparation: Shake and top with Anchor Steam.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Old Forester Bourbon, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Giffard Crème de Pêche de Vigne, .5 oz Honey syrup (local honey cut 2:1 with water), .75 oz Lemon juice, 1  Egg white, 1 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation: Combine all ingredients except the bitters and dry shake. Add ice and shake again. Strain over fresh ice into a double old fashioned glass. Dash bitters over the top of the cocktail. Garnish with a dried peach and a piece of candied ginger.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz Orange Liquor, 1.5 oz House-made Spiced Pumpkin Puree, .5 oz Lemon Juice, .5 oz Ginger Syrup, 1  Egg White,  top Apple Cider
Preparation: Combine all ingredients in a shaker, except the apple cider. Shake vigorously. Strain over ice. Top with apple cider. Garnish with shaved cinnamon and nutmeg.

Ingredients: 2 oz English Harbour Rum, .75 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 whole Egg
Preparation: Shake vigorously. Strain into highball glass. Top with Ale. Grated nutmeg.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Mezcal, .75 oz Montenegro Amaro Liquore Italiano, .75 oz Calisaya Liqueur, 2 dash Regans' Orange Bitters No. 6
Preparation: Stir and garnish lemon peel.

Ingredients: 1 oz Charbay Ruby Red Grapefruit Vodka, 1 oz Vya Dry Vermouth, .75 oz Hophead Vodka, .25 oz Small Hand Foods Pineapple Gum Syrup
Preparation: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz House-made Slivovitz (Plum Brandy), 1 oz Chamomile Tea-Infused Noilly Prat Dry Vermouth, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 3 dash Peychaud's Bitters
Preparation: Stir and strain. Hoshizaki ice.

Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz White Peach & Orange Chamomile Infused Sweet Vermouth, .5 oz Cinnamon Wineshine Brandy, 1 dash Simple Syrup, .5 oz Grapefruit Juice, .5 oz Lemon Juice, 4 oz Bundaberg Ginger Beer
2 oz Chinaco Blanco Tequila, 1 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Prickly Pear Puree, .5 oz Agave
Preparation: Mint salt on the rim. Garnish with mint sprig.

Ingredients: 2 oz Hirsch Small Batch Reserve Bourbon, .75 oz Luxardo Bitter, .5 oz Cold Blue Bottle Coffee, .25 oz Luxardo Anisette, 2 dash Peychaud's Bitters
Preparation: Build in collins glass. Top with soda. Orange peel.

Ingredients: 2 oz H by HINE, .5 oz Toasted Pecan Syrup, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .5 oz Cynar, 1 bsp Spiced Pumpkin Butter, 2 dash Cinnamon Tincture
Preparation: Shake. Double strain. King cube. Orange peel garnish

Ingredients: 2 oz Rye Whiskey, 5 oz Punt e Mes, .5 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur
1.5 oz Christmas Spirit, .25 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .5 oz Chateau de Montifaud Pineau des Charentes Rose, .75 oz Tempus Fugit Gran Classico Bitter
Preparation: Combine all ingredients and stir with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into coupe glass and garnish with a Luxardo Cherry.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Old Potrero Straight Rye Whiskey, .5 oz Lemon Juice, 2 oz Cold-pressed Apple Cider, 2 oz Hot Water, .5 oz Honey-Ginger Syrup*, 1 tsp Ghost-Pepper-Infused Campari**, 3 dash Cinnamon Tincture***
Preparation:
Add ingredients to a mug and stir.

*Honey-Ginger Syrup:
Combine 1 part ginger with 2 parts honey and 1 cup of water and boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 mins. Strain and discard solids.

**Ghost-Pepper-Infused Campari:
Soak 1 ghost pepper in a 16 oz. bottle of Campari for up to 24 hrs (reduce infusion time to reduce heat).

***Cinnamon Tincture:
Soak 3 cinnamon sticks in 16 oz. of any neutral grain alcohol that is high proof (regular 80-proof vodka is great) for up to 14 days. Strain and discard the sticks.

Ingredients: 2 oz H by HINE, .75 oz Cocchi Americano, .75 oz Dolin Rouge Vermouth, 1 dash Bittermens Hopped Grapefruit Bitters
Preparation: Stir all the ingredients over ice, then strain into a coupe. No garnish.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz White Port, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .5 oz Honey Cinnamon Syrup*, 1  Whole Egg, 8  Muddled Sage Leaves
Preparation:
Muddle the sage in a mixing tin. Add the remaining ingredients and dry shake (no ice) for 15 seconds. Add ice and shake another 15 seconds to chill down the drink. Double strain into a large coupe glass. Garnish with a whole star anise floated in the middle of the egg white.

*Honey Cinnamon Syrup:
-- 16 oz Honey
-- 2 Cinnamon Sticks
-- 8 oz Water
Combine all the ingredients together in a pot. Place on the stove and bring to a simmer, stirring the honey so it doesn’t burn and let the pot simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and place on an ice bath. Place in a container and label and date it. Store in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.
Notes: Junipero Gin 20th Anniversary Signature Cocktail

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, .75 oz Apricot Eau-de-Vie, .25 oz Grenadine, 2 dash Lemon Bitters, 2 dash Absinthe
Preparation: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass, add ice and then stir. Strain into a Nick & Nora glass and garnish with a lemon twist.
Notes: Junipero Gin 20th Anniversary Signature Cocktail

Ingredients: 1.25 oz Hophead Vodka, .5 oz Fresh Lime Juice,  splash Soda Water,  top Steam Beer
Preparation: Pour over ice in a pint glass, then fill with steam beer. Garnish with a lemon wedge and a straw.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, .75 oz Oloroso Sherry, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .75 oz Winter Spice Brown Sugar Syrup*, 1 oz Pineapple Juice
Preparation:
Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake and double strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with nutmeg.

*Winter Spice Brown Sugar Syrup: 
-- 2 qt Brown Sugar
-- 2 qt Water
-- 3 Tbsp Ground Ginger
-- 3 Tbsp Ground Nutmeg
-- 1 Tbsp Clove

Heat and simmer the below ingredients in a medium pot for 15 minutes. Strain with cheesecloth.
Notes: Junipero Gin 20th Anniversary Signature Cocktail

Ingredients: .75 oz Junipero Gin, .75 oz Tempus Fugit Kina L'Aero d'Or, .75 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .75 oz Egg Whites, .5 oz Rich Simple Syrup*
Preparation:
Add all ingredients to tin and dry shake. Add ice and vigorously shake for 12 seconds. Fine strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish by sprinkling matcha powder (.25 tsp). 

*Rich Simple Syrup: 
-- 2 cups Granulated Sugar
-- 1 cup Water

Combine sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat and stir until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat, let cool to room temperature and transfer to a clean glass jar. Cover and keep refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.

Ingredients: 2 oz Hirsch Small Batch Reserve Bourbon, 1 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, .5 oz Orange-scented Maple Syrup*, 1 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth di Torino Rosso
Preparation:
Combine bourbon, lemon juice, and syrup in a shaker and add cold ice. Shake until chilled well (10-30 sec. depending on the quality of the ice). Strain into a collins glass and slowly pour the vermouth into the glass. Garnish with a lemon twist. 

*Orange-scented Maple Syrup:
combine 6 oz. of grade B maple syrup, 6 oz. filtered water and the peel of 1 orange, with a minimum amount of pith in a non-reactive pan. 
Simmer for 10 mins. Remove from heat and allow it to cool to room temp. before using. 
Syrup will keep for 1 month if refrigerated.

Ingredients: 2 oz Avuá Prata Cachaça, 2 oz Bacardi Superior Rum, 3 oz Chateau de Montifaud Pineau des Charentes Rose, 2 oz Lime Juice, 1 oz Cannella Cinnamon Cordial, 2 oz Simple Syrup
Preparation: Build & Stir. Hoshizaki Ice.

Ingredients: 2 oz HINE Rare VSOP, .75 oz Mathilde Orange XO Liqueur, .75 oz Lemon Juice, 1 tsp Demerara Syrup (2:1)
Preparation: Shake. Strain into a coupe. Garnish with a lime twist.

Ingredients: 2 oz H by HINE, .5 oz Apple Brandy, .25 oz Benedictine, .25 oz Yellow Chartreuse, 1 dash Vieux Pontarlier Absinthe Francaise Superieure, 1 dash Peychaud's Bitters
Preparation: Stir all the ingredients over ice, then strain into a coupe. No garnish.

Ingredients: 1 oz Rittenhouse Straight Rye Whisky, .5 oz Pusser's Rum, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 2 oz Basic House Lemonade*,  top Abita Big Easy IPA
Preparation:
Shake rye, rum, lemonade, and ginger liqueur. Strain over fresh ice in a copper mug. Top with Abita Big Easy IPA (or similar session IPA). Gently stir.

*Basic House Lemonade:
-- 2 parts Water
-- 1 part Sugar
-- 1 part Lemon Juice

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Christmas Spirit, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Lemon juice, .5 oz Honey syrup, .5 oz Egg white, 2 oz Ale, 3 drops Dale DeGroff's Pimento Aromatic Bitters
Preparation: Combine all ingredients besides beer and bitters and dry shake without ice. Add ice and re-shake, double strain into a fizz glass and top with beer. Garnish with shaved nutmeg and 3 drops of bitters.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz H by HINE, .5 oz Lustau East India Solera, .25 oz Grand Marnier, .25 oz Luxardo Amaretto di Saschira, .5 oz Lemon Juice, .25 oz Simple Syrup
Preparation: Shake all the ingredients with ice, then strain into a coupe. No garnish.

Ingredients: 1 1/2 oz Chinaco Reposado, 1 oz Luxardo Amaro Abano, 1/2 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, 1/4 oz Fresh Lemon Juice
Preparation: Serve on one big rock.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 2 oz East Imperial Superior Tonic ,   Assorted Complementing Botanicals*
Preparation:
Add Junipero Gin and botanicals first. Add ice and follow with a bold tonic. Top with additional botanicals/garnish for presentation.

*Assorted Complementing Botanicals: Orange, Star Anise, Rose Petals, Italian Juniper

Ingredients: 2 oz Old Tom Gin, .5 oz Noilly Prat Ambre Vermouth, .5 oz Pineapple Juice, .5 oz Lime Juice, .25 oz Rich Simple (2:1), .75 float Dry Sparkling Wine
Preparation: Combine all ingredients, minus the sparkling wine, into a tin. Shake and double strain into a flute glass. Top with a float of sparkling wine. Garnish with an edible flower petal.

Preparation: Shake the ingredients with ice. Strain into an old fashioned glass. Garnish with a Luxardo Cherry.

Ingredients: 2 oz BarSol Primero Quebranta Pisco, .5 oz Simple Syrup, .5 oz Orange Juice, .5 oz Lemon, 1 bsp El Guapo Tonic Syrup, 4 dash El Guapo Tonic Bitters, 3  Cucumber Slices, 2  Mint Sprig
Preparation: Muddle mint and cucumber with the simple syrup in a shaker tin. Combine the remainder of the ingredients in the tin. Shake vigorously. Double strain with a fine mesh strainer into a collins glass. Fill with ice and garnish with a cucumber slice.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, .5 oz Maurin Quina, .25 oz Pineapple Gomme Syrup, 1 bsp Peated Kola Nut Tincture, 2 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation: Stir. Strain. Lemon peel garnish.

Ingredients: 2 oz BarSol Selecto Italia Pisco, .75 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, .5 oz Vanilla Agave Nectar, .5 oz Pineapple Gomme Syrup, 1.5 oz Seltzer Water
Preparation: Shake all ingredients with ice and fine strain into Collins glass. Top with seltzer water and add lavender blossom garnish.

Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz BarSol Primero Quebranta Pisco, 1 oz Amaro Sibilla, .25 oz Simple syrup,  rinse St. George Absinthe, 3 drops Fee Brothers Orange Flower Water
Preparation: Stir all ingredients except for Absinthe and Orange Flower. Strain over a chunk/sphere of ice in an old fashioned glass. Garnish with a sprig of mint, with 3 drops of Orange Flower.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Chinaco Blanco Tequila, .75 oz Sage-Cilantro-Lime Syrup,  rinse Montanaro Vermouth , 1  Pomegranate Ice Cube
Preparation: Pre-freeze pomegranate juice into one large cube. Rinse a glass with Montanaro vermouth. Dump any excess out. Build the remainder of spirits and bitters into a shaker tin. Shake vigorously. Strain over the pomegranate ice cube into a rocks glass.

Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, 5 oz Compas Box Great King Street Blended Scotch Whisky, 1 oz Byrrh Grand Quinquina, .5 oz Anchor Christmas Ale 2016*, 2 dash Bittercube Corazon Bitters, 2 dash The Bitter Truth Orange Bitters
Preparation:
Mix all ingredients in a mixing glass and stir for 15-20 secs depending on the type of ice. Strain over a large rock and garnish with an orange peel expressing the oils over the cocktail.

*Anchor Christmas Ale 2016 w/ Honey (reduction) 2:1 (2-parts Beer to 1-part Honey)

Ingredients: 2 oz Chinaco Blanco Tequila, .5 oz Lemon Juice, .5 oz Small Hand Foods Pineapple Gum Syrup, .25 oz Vanilla Syrup*, .5 oz Coconut Cream**, .5 oz Egg White
Preparation:
Combine all ingredients in a shaking tin or mixing glass and vigorously shake without ice for 10 seconds. Add ice, and shake for another 8 seconds. Strain over larger ice cube or into a cocktail glass and add freshly grated cinnamon on top.

*Vanilla Syrup: 
Split 1 vanilla pod lengthwise and scrape interior into a heavy sauce pan. 
Add 2 c. raw sugar and 2 c. water. Bring to a simmer and reduce heat to low. 
Cook for 5 mins and stir occasionally. 
Remove from heat and keep unstrained for 24 hrs. 
Strain through a cheese cloth and bottle. Keeps for 2 weeks.

**Coconut Cream:
Combine 1 part Coco Lopez with 1 part rich coconut milk. Mix well.

Ingredients: 1 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, 1 oz Dolin Rouge Vermouth, .5 oz The Genuine Curacao Liqueur Orange, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .25 oz Chareau Liqueur, .5 oz Fresh Lemon Juice,  top Fever-Tree Bitter Lemon
Preparation: Top with Fever-Tree Bitter Lemon. Build in a collins glass full of ice cubes and garnish with a lemon wheel and mint sprig.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Old Tom Gin, 1 oz Cocchi Vermouth di Torino, .5 oz Luxardo Bitter, 3 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation: Combine ingredients, stir until well chilled, and strain in to a cocktail glass. Serve with an orange twist.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, .75 oz Cocchi Americano, .5 oz Salers Gentiane Aperitif, 2 drops Black Licorice-Infused Angostura Bitters, 1 drop Sea Salt Tincture
Preparation: Stir the first three ingredients and the sea salt tincture over ice. Strain into a coupe glass and add licorice-infused Angostura Bitters. Garnish with 3 brandied cherries.

Preparation: Stir in a mixing glass with ice; strain into a coupe glass; garnish with orange and lemon zest.

Ingredients: 1.25 oz Compass Box Great King Street Glasgow Blend, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .5 oz Cyril Zangs Double Zero Eau de Vie de Cidre, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Honey Syrup, 1  Egg White
Preparation: Shake without ice, add ice and shake again then fine strain into a chilled egg coupe. Garnish with a Sage leaf.

Ingredients: 2 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz Lacuesta Blanco Vermouth, .25 oz Salers Gentiane Aperitif, 1 bsp Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, 1 bsp Germain-Robin Absinthe, 2 dash Scrappy’s Lime Bitters
Preparation: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice, stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and the edible flower of your choice.

Shake over ice and strain into a chilled cocktail coupe. Garnish with a dash of cinnamon.

*Pumpkin-Infused Glenrothes Vintage Reserve:
Peel, clean and cut small 2x2 in. pieces of sugar pumpkin. Salt very lightly and roast for about 20 mins. at 250°F. Put into a sealed container with scotch and let rest for 2 days. Strain off the pumpkin and re-bottle. Keep refrigerated.

Ingredients: 4 oz Don Cesar Pisco, 1 oz Luxardo Triplum (Triple Sec), 4 oz Apple Cider, 2 oz Oloroso Sherry, 1 oz Sherry Vinegar,   Regans' Orange Bitters,   Angostura Bitters
2 oz Junipero Gin, .75 oz House-made Cranberry Syrup*, .5 oz Lemon Juice, .5 oz Cranberry Juice, .25 oz Lillet Blanc, 4 dash Forgery Earth Day Bitters,  mist Laphroaig

Preparation: Place King's Ginger and orange bitters in a Champagne flute, and top with sparkling wine. No garnish.
Notes: Featured on The Tales of the Cocktail 2016 Carousel Bar Menu

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz Giffard Elderflower Liqueur, 1 oz Lime Juice, 8-9 drops Chili Tincture*, 6  Luxardo Maraschino Cherries
Preparation:
Combine the lime, elderflower, tincture and cherries into a shaker tin. Muddle the cherries and then add the Junipero Gin. Shake with ice. Double strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.

*Chili Tincture:

Preparation: Combine all ingredients into a large punch bowl and add large ice cube/cubes. Garnish liberally with slice fruits.

Ingredients: 1.25 oz Glenrothes Vintage Reserve, .75 oz Drambuie, 2 oz Woodchuck Pumpkin Cider, .75 oz Spiced Butter*, 3 dash Bittermens Elemakule Tiki Bitters
Preparation:
Heat cider to 180°F. In a 5 oz cup pour the scotch and drambuie. Add the heated cider. Stir in the spiced butter. Top with 3 drops bitters.

For the garnish, add 2 small cocktail stirrers, hang cookie off of the stirrer so that it leans off of the side of the cup.

*Spiced Butter:
-- 1 half Stick Butter
-- 1 tbsp Pumpkin Pie Spice
-- .5 tbsp Brown Sugar
-- .5 tsp Cayenne Pepper

Soften butter, add spices and mix with a spoon until all ingredients are combined.

**Chrusciki Cookies:
-- 1 c All-purpose Flour
-- 3 Egg Yolks
-- 3 tbsp Sour Cream
-- 1 tsp Vanilla Extract
-- 1 tbsp Dark Rum
-- 1 pinch Salt

Using a mixer, incorporate egg yolks into sour cream, add vanilla and rum, kneed in all-purpose flower and salt to taste.
Divide dough in half on a floured board and let rest for 20 min. Working with half the dough at a time, roll out to 1/8 in. thickness, cut into 2 in. wide strips, cut these strips on the diagonal at 4 in. intervals.
Heat 2 in. of vegetable oil in a large deep skillet to 350°F. Make a slit in the center of each strip of dough. Pull one end through the slit to form a bow.
Fry 6 Chrusciki at a time for 1 min. or less per side till golden brown.
Drain on a paper towel and dust with confectioners sugar.

Ingredients: .75 oz Junipero Gin, .75 oz H by HINE, .75 oz Chateau de Montifaud Pineau des Charentes Blanc, .75 oz Oloroso & Moscatel Blend*, 2 dash The Bitter Truth Xocolate Bitters, 2 dash Orange Bitters,   Walnut Oil

Blend ingredients.

*Ginger/Cardamom/Honey Syrup:
Bring about 8 cups of water to a boil, once boiling turn off heat and add 2 cups of cardamom pods. Let sit for about 6 hours. Strain the pods out, add 1 qt (32 oz) of honey and stir until dissolved. For an added cardamom boost: place the cardamom pods with the cardamom/honey "tea" in a blender. Blend and press through a fine strainer so as to discard the solids but keep the flavor.

Ingredients: 1.25 oz Old Potrero Straight Rye Whiskey (Toasted Coconut Infused)*, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 1.25 oz Turmeric Coconut Cream**
Preparation:
Shaken slightly. Served over shaved ice in an old fashioned glass. Garnished with turmeric toasted coconut flakes.

*Toasted Coconut Infused Old Potrero
-- 750ml Old Potrero Straight Rye Whiskey
-- 2.5 oz Toasted Coconut

Combine all ingredients in a clean container and let sit for 8 hours.
Strain through cheesecloth and then funnel back into your Old Potrero bottles.
Keeps indefinitely.

**Turmeric Coconut Cream:
-- 12 g Fresh Turmeric
-- 1 c Water
-- 1 c Honey
-- 3 tsp Black Pepper
-- 12 oz Coconut Milk

Grate fresh turmeric into 1 cup water.
Bring to a boil, add 1 cup of honey and stir.
Remove from heat and let the mix sit for 1:30 hours.
Strain out turmeric and add 3 tsp. ground black pepper.
Add 12 oz. coconut milk and stir.
Place in an airtight container and keep in the fridge. Use within a week.
